availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Warren Horr (Clark County, Indiana, sheriff, merchant, capt & maj 4th IN Cav USA)

body.p: Clark County, Indiana, sheriff, merchant, and soldier. New York native. Married to Elizabeth S. Taylor Horr in Oldham County, Kentucky, on August 10, 1841. Father of Elizabeth Horr, Anna Belle Horr, Emma F. Horr, Nora L. Horr, Foster G. Horr, Lilian Lucy Horr, George V. Horr, and Julia I. Horr. Merchant in Oldham County in 1850. Employed G. I. Todd and Woodin Metcalf as clerks in Oldham County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Sheriff of Clark County, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 4th Indiana Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (77th Regiment) (U.S.A.) as captain and major from September 4, 1862, to January 25, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 2, p. 119A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 2, p. 119A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Charlestown, p. 152.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville Ward 5, p. 507B.
Find A Grave, "Dr Warren Horr (1817-1895)," Memorial #107048062, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107048062/warren-horr (accessed July 21, 2021).
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Indiana, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M765, Roll 2, Clark County, Indiana, 1863, p. 7.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film #000482446.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. 3, 1861-1866 (Indianapolis: Samuel M. Douglass, State Printer, 1866), 44.
